transportAdvice: Ibiza has a public bus network connecting the main towns, beaches, and airport, though services can be infrequent outside summer months; taxis are widely available and are the most convenient option for late-night travel. The old town is walkable, but reaching beaches and clubs across the island generally requires a vehicle, taxi, or bus.

weather.description: Cool and quiet with occasional rain; most tourist facilities are closed and the island is very peaceful.
Still mild and uncrowded with some rainy spells; a good time for hiking and exploring the island without crowds.
Temperatures begin to rise and days grow longer; the island starts to wake up but remains quiet.
Pleasant spring weather with warm sunny days; a great time to visit before the summer rush begins.
Warm and increasingly sunny; beach season begins and the island starts to fill with early-season visitors.
Hot and sunny with the nightlife season kicking off; beaches are busy and the party atmosphere builds.
Peak summer heat with long sunny days; the island is at its busiest with beaches, clubs, and restaurants packed.
The hottest and most crowded month; expect high prices, full beaches, and the nightlife scene at its most intense.
Still warm and sunny with slightly fewer crowds; one of the best months to visit for a balance of weather and atmosphere.
Noticeably cooler with some rain returning; many clubs close for the season but the island remains pleasant for relaxing.
Quiet and mild with increasing rainfall; most tourist infrastructure winds down and the island returns to local life.
Cool winter weather with short days; very few tourists and a calm, authentic atmosphere across the island.
